benefits.title: Effect of l-carnitine therapy on patients in maintenance hemodialysis: a systematic review and meta-analysis
benefits.summary: L-carnitine therapy did not improve inflammation, oxidative stress, nutrition, anemia, dyslipidemia, hyperparathyroidism status, or quality of life in hemodialysis patients.

benefits.title: Influence of L-Carnitine Supplementation on Serum Lipid Profile in Hemodialysis Patients: A Systematic Review and Meta-Analysis
benefits.summary: L-carnitine supplementation can significantly decrease LDL-cholesterol in hemodialysis patients.

benefits.title: Role of carnitine in disease
benefits.summary: L-carnitine supplementation can improve nerve conduction, neuropathic pain, immune function in diabetes patients, and may be beneficial in treating obesity, improving glucose intolerance, and total energy expenditure.

benefits.title: Carnitines and male infertility.
benefits.summary: L-Carnitine and acetyl-L-carnitine at daily amounts of at least 3g can significantly improve sperm concentration and total sperm counts among men with astheno- or oligoasthenozoospermia.

benefits.title: Supplementation of L-carnitine in athletes: does it make sense?
benefits.summary: L-carnitine supplementation may foster exercise performance, stimulate lipid metabolism, decrease postexercise plasma lactate, and speed up recovery from exercise stress.

benefits.title: l-Carnitine Supplementation in Recovery after Exercise
benefits.summary: L-carnitine supplementation enhances exercise capacity, reduces muscle injury, and improves recovery, potentially leading to increased muscle mass, decreased body weight, and reduced fatigue.

benefits.title: L-Carnitine protects plasma components against oxidative alterations.
benefits.summary: L-carnitine possesses antioxidative activity and protects plasma proteins and lipids against oxidative/nitrative damage.

benefits.title: l-Carnitine
benefits.summary: L-carnitine improves motor skills, muscle weakness, and wasting, and has beneficial effects on myocardial function and metabolism in patients with primary carnitine deficiencies.

benefits.title: An update on potential applications of L-carnitine in poultry
benefits.summary: L-carnitine increases energy production, fat metabolism, and improves immune status in birds, benefiting poultry health and production.

benefits.title: L-carnitine--metabolic functions and meaning in humans life.
benefits.summary: L-carnitine helps reduce oxidative stress, potentially treating heart failure, angina, and weight loss, but further research is needed for other conditions.

side effects.title: L-Carnitine inhibits cisplatin-induced injury of the kidney and small intestine.
side effects.summary: L-carnitine strongly inhibits cisplatin-induced mitochondrial dysfunction, DNA injury, lipid peroxidation, and apoptosis of epithelial cells in the kidney and small intestine.

side effects.title: L-carnitine administration in coronary artery disease and cardiomyopathy.
side effects.summary: Mild nausea and vomiting are side effects of L-carnitine, but doses up to 2g/day in 3 divided doses may not have any side effects.
side effects.journal: The Journal of the Association of Physicians of India

side effects.title: Influence of L-carnitine on CD95 cross-lining-induced apoptosis and ceramide generation in human cell lines: correlation with its effects on purified acidic and neutral sphingomyelinases in vitro.
side effects.summary: L-carnitine administration reduces apoptosis and increases CD4 and CD8 cells without causing side effects in AIDS patients.
side effects.journal: Proceedings of the Association of American Physicians

side effects.title: Long-Term Effects of Neonatal Treatment With Dexamethasone, l-Carnitine, and Combinations Thereof in Rats
side effects.summary: L-CAR treatment caused one-third less food intake in later life, but rats maintained normal body weight.

side effects.title: Effect of l-carnitine supplementation on muscle cramps induced by stroke: A case report.
side effects.summary: L-carnitine supplementation reduced nocturnal leg cramps and alleviated sleep disturbance in a patient with cerebral infarction.

side effects.title: Therapy of L- carnitine Supplementation in Maintenance Hemodialysis Patients
side effects.summary: Intravenous L-carnitine supplementation improves protein-energy malnutrition, corrects anemia, and decreases dialysis-related hypotension and recurrent cramps in maintenance hemodialysis patients.

side effects.title: A prospective double-blind, randomized clinical trial of levocarnitine to treat autism spectrum disorders
side effects.summary: L-carnitine therapy (50 mg/kilogram-bodyweight/day) was generally well-tolerated and significantly improved several clinical measurements of ASD severity.
side effects.journal: Medical Science Monitor : International Medical Journal of Experimental and Clinical Research

side effects.title: The effectiveness of L-Carnitine in improving liver enzymes in Leukemic patients treated with Methotrexate and 6-Mercaptopurine
side effects.summary: L-carnitine is effective in improving liver enzyme levels in patients treated with methotrexate and 6-mercaptopurine.

side effects.title: Beneficial effects of L-carnitine in myoblastic C2C12 cells. Interaction with zidovudine.
side effects.summary: L-carnitine supplementation prevents the effects of zidovudine and restores normal cell growth in myoblastic C2C12 cells.

side effects.title: L-carnitine reduces doxorubicin-induced apoptosis through a prostacyclin-mediated pathway in neonatal rat cardiomyocytes.
side effects.summary: L-carnitine protects cardiomyocytes from doxorubicin-induced apoptosis through a prostacyclin-mediated pathway.

dosage.title: Favorable effects of L-carnitine treatment on hypertriglyceridemia in hemodialysis patients: decisive role of low levels of high-density lipoprotein-cholesterol.
dosage.summary: L-carnitine dosage should be 20 mg/kg IV at the end of each dialysis for 120 days, with 60 mg/kg IV being considered for nonresponders.
dosage.journal: The American journal of clinical nutrition

dosage.title: Effect of dietary L-carnitine on growth performance and body composition in nursery and growing-finishing pigs.
dosage.summary: The optimal dosage of L-carnitine for growing-finishing pigs is between 49 and 64 ppm.

dosage.title: Efficacy and tolerability of combined treatment with L-carnitine and simvastatin in lowering lipoprotein(a) serum levels in patients with type 2 diabetes mellitus.
dosage.summary: L-carnitine was administered at a dosage of 2g/day once daily in this study.

dosage.title: Impact of L-carnitine in narcolepsy treatment: a systematic review on the effectiveness and safety
dosage.summary: L-carnitine therapy is efficacious and well-tolerated at dosages ranging from 500 to 510 mg/day for narcolepsy patients.

dosage.title: Clinical Effects of L-Carnitine Supplementation on Physical Performance in Healthy Subjects, the Key to Success in Rehabilitation: A Systematic Review and Meta-Analysis from the Rehabilitation Point of View
dosage.summary: The dosage of L-carnitine supplementation that significantly changed serum total carnitine was 2 g/dL for 4 weeks at rest, 1 g/dL for 3 weeks after exercise, and 2 g/dL for 4 weeks at rest.
dosage.journal: Journal of Functional Morphology and Kinesiology

dosage.title: l‐Carnitine Supplementation in Childhood Epilepsy: Current Perspectives
dosage.summary: Oral L-carnitine dosage is recommended at 100 mg/kg/day, up to a maximum of 2 g/day.

dosage.title: Plasma and red blood cell carnitine and carnitine esters during L-carnitine therapy in hemodialysis patients.
dosage.summary: Low-dose L-carnitine treatment at 5 and 15 mg/kg body wt is sufficient to correct disturbed plasma and RBC carnitine and carnitine esters in hemodialysis patients.
dosage.journal: The American journal of clinical nutrition

dosage.title: Muscle Carnitine Repletion by Long-Term Carnitine Supplementation in Nephropathic Cystinosis
dosage.summary: Oral L-carnitine replacement can normalize muscle carnitine content in children with cystinosis at a dosage of 92 mg/kg/d given every 6 hours.

dosage.title: Effect of dosage and application mode of L-carnitine on plasma lipid and egg-yolk cholesterol of turkeys, hatchability of eggs and post-hatch growth of their offsprings.
dosage.summary: Dietary supplementation of 50 ppm L-carnitine for turkey hens improved serum lipid profile, egg fertility, reduced dead-in-shell, egg-yolk cholesterol, and resulted in improved post-hatch growth performance.
dosage.journal: Journal of animal physiology and animal nutrition

dosage.title: A Pilot Clinical Trial on L-Carnitine Supplementation in Combination with Motivation Training: Effects on Weight Management in Healthy Volunteers
dosage.summary: A low dosage (500 mg/day) of L-carnitine supplementation in combination with motivation training led to significant body weight loss and improved serum adiponectin levels.
